definition: (sports) draw/tie
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill

sentences.english: The score was tied in the first inning.
sentences.chinese: 第一局比赛打了个平手。

sentences.english: The team played very hard, but could not get out of the hole .
sentences.chinese: 该队打得很卖力，但仍然不能打成平手。

sentences.english: 'We fought the issue to a draw, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这件事上算是打了个平手。

sentences.english: How long did they stay on deuce?
sentences.chinese: “平手”的局面他们维持了多久？

sentences.english: So, we are even. Now, let's start all over.
sentences.chinese: 好了，现在我们达成平手了，重新开始吧。

sentences.english: So this category is a draw.
You might say they had loved each other to a draw.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以说他们对彼此之爱打了个平手。

sentences.english: Then I won the tie-breaker to take the final set .
sentences.chinese: 然而你打破平手的僵局赢得最后一盘赛。

sentences.english: Judith 'll have to get seven more points to take lead.
sentences.chinese: 再拿一分我们就打成平手。

sentences.english: In this respect, I declare this one a tie.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到这些方面，我宣布二者在这一回合中打成平手。

sentences.english: One more point and we'll be tying.
sentences.chinese: 再拿一分我们就打成平手。

sentences.english: How do they go to deuce every time?

definition: to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
a draw (in competition)/a tie
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
evenly matched (idiom)
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
not to know one's place
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
almost on a par
equally matched/about the same
a tie-break/to determine the winner
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
